content: In the Harry Potter series, what magical artifact was said to grant its owner immortality?

In the Harry Potter series, the Philosopher's Stone (known as the Sorcerer's Stone in the US version) is a magical artifact that is said to grant its owner immortality. It can create the Elixir of Life, which allows the drinker to live forever, and also produces the Philosopher's/Sorcerer's Stone itself, which can transform any metal into pure gold. The stone plays a central role in the first book and movie of the series, where Harry Potter and his friends must prevent it from falling into the hands of the evil wizard, Voldemort.
